title: Man arrested over family found living in cellar for 9 years 'waiting for end of time'
text:

A suspect has been arrested after a family-of-seven spent nine years in a cellar "waiting for the end of time".

One of the group, Jan Zon van Dorsten, managed to flee to a nearby bar on Sunday but after, ordering five beers, said he couldn't go home.

Jan's brothers and sisters, aged between 18 and 25, had been living in the farmhouse cellar, police in Drenthe, Netherlands, say.

Now a 58-year-old Austrian, named only as Josef B, has been arrested in connection with the investigation.

But Roger de Groot, mayor for the area, said the man, said to be a skilled woodcutter, is not the father of the family.

Neighbours in the remote rural area spoke for the first time since the family were found.

(Image: Hollandse Hoogte/Press Association Images)

Roelie van Dijk, who lives nearby, said: "It's possible here ... (it) is such a remote spot, in the middle of fields.

"You see it can happen anywhere. Not only in a big city but also in the countryside. And perhaps even more in the countryside, where you

can hide completely."

Van Dijk said she and her husband had seen a man driving in and out of the property for years and doing construction work.

He always kept the gates closed and never socialised, she said.

(Image: Hollandse Hoogte/REX)

Her husband Sjon said he once asked to see how the renovations were coming along, but the man yelled "no" and sped off.

"We tried to make contact, my husband just last week, with the man in the car...(But) he drove on. He went through the gates and locked them again."

Another homeowner in the area said: "We are quite perplexed about it all."

The siblings had reportedly lived in makeshift rooms inside the farm and survived partly on vegetables and animals from a secluded garden on the property.

(Image: Hollandse Hoogte/REX)

But in a statement, police said they found the family in a "small space in the house which could be locked" and that it was unclear whether they were being held against their will.

"The man is still in custody and is being questioned," said a Drenthe police spokeswoman.

"A lot is still unclear and we are investigating exactly what happened there."
description: Police in Drenthe, Netherlands, have detained a 58-year-old over the incident at a remote farmhouse
